intro: Byrsocarpus albidoflavescens, commonly known as the white-yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
